tool.name: FlankBed

param.name: pct
param.label: Define -l and -r as a fraction of the feature’s length
param.help: E.g. if used on a 1000bp feature, -l 0.50, will add 500 bp “upstream”

param.name: strand
param.label: Define -l and -r based on strand
param.help: For example. if used, -l 500 for a negative-stranded feature, it will add 500 bp to the end coordinate

param.name: addition_select
param.label: Choose what you want to do
param.option: Increase the BED/GFF/VCF entry by the same number base pairs in each direction.
Increase by Start Coordinate and End Coordinate

param.name: l
param.label: The number of base pairs to subtract from the start coordinate

param.name: r
param.label: The number of base pairs to add to the end coordinate

tool.help:
**What it does**
bedtools flank will optionally create flanking intervals whose size is user-specified fraction of the original interval.
.. image:: $PATH_TO_IMAGES/flank-glyph.png
.. class:: warningmark
In order to prevent creating intervals that violate chromosome boundaries, bedtools flank requires a genome file defining the length of each chromosome or contig.
